channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 1
item.description:
May 01, 2020 7:40 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Friday, May 1.

item.title: Petrol prices drop to $2 level, a week after crude oil's record lows
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Pump prices here have fallen by up to six cents a litre, a week after crude oil plunged to record lows.

item.title: Woman, 58, is youngest Covid-19 patient here to die; IMH among new clusters
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A 58-year-old woman died yesterday from complications due to Covid-19 infection, bringing the total number of such deaths here to 15.

item.title: Fund to help migrant workers, address longer-term needs
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A new fund has been set up to help foreign workers who could lose their jobs if their employers fold due to the coronavirus outbreak. It will also address longer-term issues they could face.

item.title: Website offering law internships, jobs under investigation
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The Law Society of Singapore has cautioned against "hungry wolves in sheep's clothing" as it investigates a website touting an expensive programme to help law students and graduates secure internship and jobs.

item.title: Covid-19 Support Grant: More workers now eligible
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

More Singaporeans are now eligible for financial help if their jobs have been affected by the Covid-19 outbreak and the measures taken to contain it.

item.title: $27m support package to tide maritime sector over coronavirus pandemic
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore maritime industry will get $27 million in aid to tide it over the coronavirus outbreak, the Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) announced late on Wednesday night.

item.title: Online jazz concert chases Covid-19 blues away
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A jazz concert that aired on Facebook and YouTube last night chased the Covid-19 blues away with swinging renditions of classics such as Singapura and jazz standard I Can't Get Started.

item.title: Outbreak in dorms may take a few weeks before it's under control
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

It may take a few weeks before infection numbers in foreign workers' dormitories become low enough to signal that the Covid-19 outbreak is under control in those quarters, said the Health Ministry's chief health scientist, Professor Tan Chorh Chuan.

item.title: No celebrations, but May Day remains especially important: DPM Heng
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

May Day became a public holiday in Singapore some 60 years ago to commemorate the strength and solidarity of workers.

item.title: Coronavirus: 100 SAF soldiers deployed at Expo care facility
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Private Terrenjit Gill was excited when he found out that he would be deployed to the Singapore Expo to care for Covid-19 patients. This was an opportunity to put his training as a Singapore Armed Forces medic to good use.

item.title: MOH's first chief health scientist
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Professor Tan Chorh Chuan, the former president of the National University of Singapore, has served as the Ministry of Health's (MOH) first chief health scientist since 2018.

item.title: Singapore to take a step by step approach to restarting economy
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Not all businesses will be able to start work immediately when the coronavirus situation improves, as Singapore plans a "step by step" approach to restarting its economy, said Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Grab encourages staff to take voluntary no-pay leave
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Grab has cut the pay of its senior management by up to 20 per cent and encouraged its staff to take voluntary no-pay leave.

item.title: No other way but to make use of TraceTogether mandatory
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

It is apparent that people will not give up their data willingly even in a public health emergency. A degree of compulsion is needed.

item.title: President urges workers, companies to be ready for big changes after crisis
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Society will see major changes to work, the workforce and workplaces after the coronavirus crisis, President Halimah Yacob said in her May Day message on Facebook yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: No 'golden week' bonanza for Singapore travel agencies
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

With a ban on short-term visitors to Singapore still in force, local travel agencies say they are not expecting any business during the "golden week" holiday, which starts today and is especially popular with East Asian travellers.

item.title: Fine balance needed to allow life to go on more normally: Expert
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Researchers and policymakers will be striving to maintain a delicate balance to keep the Covid-19 outbreak in check in coming months while allowing life to carry on more normally, the Health Ministry's chief health scientist said yesterday.

item.title: PM Lee pledges help for firms, workers to adapt to new normal
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore faces a greater challenge than most others, given it is small and so open to the world, as the coronavirus pandemic fundamentally changes the way the global economy works.

item.title: Coronavirus: Changi Airport T2 closes today, upgrade works to be accelerated
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Changi Airport's Terminal 2 will be closed for 18 months from today as the airport cuts costs during the Covid-19 pandemic and gets a head start on planned upgrade works.

item.title: S'pore scientists develop quick test to detect neutralising antibodies
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Local scientists have developed a test kit which can tell in a matter of hours if a person has antibodies that can neutralise the coronavirus.

item.title: Sengkang hospital supporting workers who helped build it
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The S11 Dormitory in Punggol is Singapore's largest Covid-19 cluster, with over 2,400 cases to date.

item.title: Closed pools in condo turn green due to halt in maintenance
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The change in colour is due to algae forming at the base of the pools.

item.title: More need to use contact tracing app for it to be effective
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

About 1.1 million people - or one-fifth of Singapore's population - have downloaded the contact tracing app, TraceTogether.

item.title: Unionists say they are working with firms to save jobs
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Workers are concerned and companies are struggling with cost pressures, but both sides are finding ways to manage the coronavirus crisis, union leaders said following Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong's May Day message yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Companies donate food to migrant workers, underprivileged
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

As the country is about to hit the one-month mark in the circuit breaker period, food companies are stepping up and donating food to migrant workers staying in dormitories and other groups in need.

item.title: Singaporeans keep their spirits up with song and music
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

All over the island and even across the seas, Singaporeans have turned to song and music to help keep spirits high while staying safe at home during the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: No effort will be spared to see SIA, aviation sector through crisis: PM
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

No effort will be spared to ensure that Singapore Airlines and the aviation sector will see through the current crisis, Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said yesterday.

item.title: Common framework to safeguard citizens' personal data set up
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The public will now be able to whistleblow on suspected data breaches by government agencies under a common framework to safeguard citizens' personal data.

item.title: Transport Minister Khaw Boon Wan breaks fast with workers in e-buka puasa
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

With circuit breaker measures in force, a Zoom video conference was the setting yesterday in which Transport Minister Khaw Boon Wan broke fast with 19 Muslim transport workers observing the holy month of Ramadan.

item.title: Going to a mall, supermarket or wet market? Take NRIC with you
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

All shoppers wishing to enter malls, supermarkets and wet markets have been advised to bring along their NRICs or other forms of photo identification with a barcode for scanning to support contact tracing efforts.

item.title: Downpour leads to flood in Hougang
item.description:
May 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A downpour yesterday afternoon resulted in flood waters rising so much that they partially submerged the tyres of several cars in Jalan Lokam, near Kensington Square condominium in Hougang.

item.title: Workers' Party calls for changes to environment for workers in Labour Day message
item.description:
May 01, 2020 12:10 AM

SINGAPORE - Singapore should prepare for a post-Covid-19 future by improving the environment for workers , said the Worker's Party in its Labour Day message
